page.title: 07MODERN USES OF MILLS (1)
page.content: In the second half of the eighteenth century and the early years of the present century,many textile mills were built in this area.Some of these mills are still in use today,though in most cases they have been adapted to meet modern requirements. Spur Mill,situated at the corner of Greg Street and Broadstone Hall Road South, was erected in 1919,and since that time has continued to be the site of wool,fabrics and textile production. On the other hand,Lancashire Hill Mill, situated just to the east of Manchester Road near to the Lancashire Hill roundabout, is no longer used for its original purpose. The main part of the old mill is now used as a packaging depot, and the adjoining buildings have been turned into small workshops.
